style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;shadow=0;sketch=0;shadowColor=#33FFFF;textShadow=1;fontColor=#FFFFFF;shadowOpacity=80;fontSize=17;" boot Application server.</div><ul><li>Filters</li><li>Controllers</li><li>Mappers</li><li>View representation</li></ul><p></p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="53" y="220" width="270.25" height="124" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-11" value="Spring Batch Job Aplication" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;shadow=0;sketch=0;shadowColor=#33FFFF;textShadow=1;fontColor=#FFFFFF;shadowOpacity=80;fontSize=17;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="66" y="387" width="242" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-12" value="<p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"></p><div>Set of configured Spring BatchJobs.</div><ul><li>Jobs</li><li>Flows</li><li>Partitioners</li><li>Readers</li><li>Processors</li><li>Writers</li></ul><p></p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="56" y="437" width="241.5" height="121" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Rrx-HjKqoxz2m87J-T63-1" value="<h1 style="font-weight: 200; font-family: Roboto, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, sans-serif; letter-spacing: 0.8px; background-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">Project Setup &amp; Resources decoupling.</h1><p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;">Gradle, Java, Spring autoconfiguration &amp; codebase.<br style="font-size: 18px;"></p>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;fontSize=18;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="22.45" y="10" width="690.55" height="76" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-9" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;exitX=0;exitY=0.75;exitDx=0;exitDy=0;entryX=1;entryY=0.5;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;strokeColor=#FFFFFF;curved=1;dashed=1;" edge="1" parent="1" source="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-3" target="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-6"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="414.25" y="449" as="sourcePoint" /> <mxPoint x="323.25" y="340" as="targetPoint" /> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="370" y="417" /> <mxPoint x="370" y="485" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-15" value="<div style="background-color: rgb(43, 43, 43);"><pre style="font-family: &quot;JetBrains Mono&quot;, monospace;"><span style="color: rgb(128, 128, 128);">//gradle file sample<br></span><font color="#a9b7c6">dependencies </font><span style="color: rgb(169, 183, 198); font-weight: bold;">{<br></span><span style="color: rgb(169, 183, 198); font-weight: bold;"> </span><font color="#a9b7c6">implementation </font><span style="color: rgb(152, 118, 170);">project</span><font color="#a9b7c6">(</font><span style="color: rgb(106, 135, 89);">':core-serivices'</span><font color="#a9b7c6">)<br> implementation </font><font color="#9876aa">...</font><font color="#a9b7c6"><br></font><span style="color: rgb(169, 183, 198); font-weight: bold;">}</span></pre></div>" style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="771" y="146" width="343" height="105" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-17" value="" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;" edge="1" parent="1" target="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-15"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="1121.5" y="295" as="sourcePoint" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-18" value="<div style="background-color:#2b2b2b;color:#a9b7c6"><pre style="font-family:'JetBrains Mono',monospace;font-size:9,8pt;"><span style="color:#bbb529;">@ComponentScan</span>(<span style="color:#6a8759;">"com.coreservices.*"</span>)<br><span style="color:#bbb529;">@EnableAutoConfiguration<br></span><span style="color:#cc7832;">public class </span>BatchJobApplication {<br><br> <span style="color:#cc7832;">public static void </span><span style="color:#ffc66d;">main</span>(String[] args) <span style="color:#cc7832;">throws </span>Exception { <br> SpringApplication.<span style="font-style:italic;">run</span>(BatchApplication.<span style="color:#cc7832;">class, </span>args)<span style="color:#cc7832;">;<br></span><span style="color:#cc7832;"> </span>}<br>}</pre></div>" style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="771" y="256" width="469" height="161" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-19" value="<div style="background-color:#2b2b2b;color:#a9b7c6"><pre style="font-family:'JetBrains Mono',monospace;font-size:9,8pt;"><span style="color:#bbb529;">@ComponentScan</span>(<span style="color:#6a8759;">"com.coreservices.*"</span>)<br><span style="color:#bbb529;">@EnableAutoConfiguration<br></span><span style="color:#cc7832;">public class </span>BootApplicationServer {<br><br> <span style="color:#cc7832;">public static void </span><span style="color:#ffc66d;">main</span>(String[] args) <span style="color:#cc7832;">throws </span>Exception {<br> SpringApplication.<span style="font-style:italic;">run</span>(BootApplicationServer.<span style="white-space: normal; color: rgb(204, 120, 50);">class, </span><span style="white-space: normal;">args)</span><span style="white-space: normal; color: rgb(204, 120, 50);">;&nbsp;</span><br><span style="color:#cc7832;"> </span>}<br>}</pre></div>" style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="773" y="401" width="490" height="161" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="C9NFJofqt5_96wF3lopT-20" value="A well-designed batch application should clearly separate batch processing resources from the application server, while allowing business layer services to be shared between them. Using Gradle along with Spring's component scanning and auto-configuration, you can achieve this seamlessly within the Spring Core framework." style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="22.45" y="86" width="720.5" height="56" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

div.div: A well-designed batch application should clearly separate batch processing resources from the application server, while allowing business layer services to be shared between them. Using Gradle along with Spring's component scanning and auto-configuration, you can achieve this seamlessly within the Spring Core framework.
